title: Common Commands
content:
cp # Copy files/folders between a container and the local filesystem. See also Docker Documentation.
docker cp ./some_file CONTAINER:/work docker cp CONTAINER:/var/logs/ /tmp/app_logs Find sha256 # docker inspect --format='{{index .RepoDigests 0}}' $IMAGE See also Where can I find the sha256 code of a docker image?.

title: File
content:
Extension # System.IO.Path.GetExtension # [System.IO.Path]::GetExtension(Draftv2.zip) Returns the extension (including the period “.”) of the specified path string. See also M$ Learn.
FileSystemInfo.Extension # > (Get-ChildItem Draftv2.zip).Extension .zip > (Get-Item Draftv2.zip).Extension .zip Gets the extension part of the file name, including the leading dot . even if it is the entire file name, or an empty string if no extension is present. See also M$ Learn.
Expand-Archive # Expand-Archive -Path Draftv2.zip -DestinationPath C:\Reference The Expand-Archive cmdlet extracts files from a specified zipped archive file to a specified destination folder. See also M$ Learn.

title: Common Expressions
content: CASE # CASE WHEN condition1 THEN result1 WHEN condition2 THEN result2 WHEN conditionN THEN resultN ELSE result END; The CASE expression goes through conditions and returns a value when the first condition is met (like an if-then-else statement). So, once a condition is true, it will stop reading and return the result. If no conditions are true, it returns the value in the ELSE clause.If there is no ELSE part and no conditions are true, it returns NULL. See also w3schools.

title: Common Commands
content:
Database # DBSIZE # DBSIZE Return the number of keys in the currently-selected database. see also redis.io.
FLUSHALL # FLUSHALL [ASYNC | SYNC] Remove all keys from all database. see also redis.io.
FLUSHDB # FLUSHDB [ASYNC | SYNC] Remove all keys from the current database. see also redis.io.
SELECT # SELECT index Change the selected database for the current connection. see also redis.io.
Key # KEYS # KEYS pattern Returns all keys matching pattern. See also redis.io.
EXISTS # EXISTS key [key ...] Determine if a key exists. See also redis.io.
EXPIRE # EXPIRE key seconds [NX | XX | GT | LT] Set a key’s time to live in seconds. See also redis.io.
TTL # TTL key Get the time to live for a key in seconds. See also redis.io.
TYPE # TYPE key Determine the type stored at key. See also redis.io.

APPEND # APPEND key value Append a value to a key. See also redis.io.
SET # SET key value [NX | XX] [GET] [EX seconds | PX milliseconds | EXAT unix-time-seconds | PXAT unix-time-milliseconds | KEEPTTL] Set the string value of a key. See also redis.io.

MGET # MGET key [key ...] Get the values of all given keys. See also redis.io.

MSETNX # MSETNX key value [key value ...] Set multiple keys to multiple values, only if none of the key exist. See also redis.io.
INCR # INCR key Increment the integer value of a key by one. See also redis.io.
DECR # DECR key Decrement the integer value of a key by one. See also redis.io.
INCRBY # INCRBY key increment Increment the integer value of a key by the given number. See also redis.io.
DECRBY # DECRBY key decrement Decrement the integer value of a key by the given number. See also redis.io.
List # LPUSH # LPUSH key element [element ...] Prepend one or multiple elements to a list. See also redis.io.
RPUSH # RPUSH key element [element ...] Apend one or multiple elements to a list. See also redis.io.
LRANGE # LRANGE key start stop Get a range of elements from a list. See also redis.io.
LINDEX # LINDEX key index Get an element from a list by its index. See also redis.io.
LPOP # LPOP key [count] Remove and get the first elements in a list. See also redis.io.
RPOP # RPOP key [count] Remove and get the last elements in a list. See also redis.io .
LLEN # LLEN key Get the length of a list. See also redis.io.
LREM # LREM key count element Remove elements of a list. See also redis.io.
LTRIM # LTRIM key start stop Trim the list to the specified range. See also redis.io.
LSET # LSET key index element Set the value of an element in a list by its index. See also redis.io.
LINSERT # LINSERT key <BEFORE | AFTER> pivot element Insert an element before or after another element in list. See also redis.io.
Set # SADD # SADD key member [member ...] Add one or more members to a set. See also redis.io.
SMEMBERS # SMEMBERS key Get all the members in a set. See also redis.io.
SISMEMBER # SISMEMBER key member Determine if a given value is a member of a set. See also redis.io.
SCARD # SCARD key Get the number of members in a set. See also redis.io.
SREM # SREM key member [member ...] Remove one or more members from a set. See also redis.io.
SRANDMEMBER # SRANDMEMBER key [count] Get one or multiple random members from a set. See also redis.io.
SPOP # SPOP key [count] Remove and return one or multiple random members from a set. See also redis.io.
SMOVE # SMOVE source destination member Move a member from one set to another. See also redis.io.
SDIFF # SDIFF key [key ...] Subtract multiple sets. See also redis.io.
SINTER # SINTER key [key ...] Intersect multiple sets. See also redis.io.
SUNION # SUNION key [key ...] Add multiple sets. See also redis.io.
Hash # HGET # HGET key field Get the value of a hash field. See also redis.io.
HSET # HSET key field value [field value ...] Set the string value of a hash field. See also redis.io.
HMGET # HMGET key field [field ...] Get the values of all given hash fields. See also redis.io.
HGETALL # HGETALL key Get all the fields and values in a hash. See also redis.io.
HDEL # HDEL key field [field ...] Delete one or more hash fields. See also redis.io.
HLEN # HLEN key Get the number of fields in a hash. See also redis.io.
HEXISTS # HEXISTS key field Determine if a hash field exists. See also redis.io.
HKEYS # HEXISTS key field Get all the fields in a hash. See also redis.io.
HVALS # HVALS key Get all the values in a hash. See also redis.io.
HINCRBY # HINCRBY key field increment Increment the integer value of a hash field by the given number. redis.io.
HSETNX # HSETNX key field value Set the value of a hash field, only if the field does not exist. See also redis.io.
Sorted Set # ZADD # ZADD key [NX | XX] [GT | LT] [CH] [INCR] score member [score member...] Add one or more members to a sorted set, or update its score if it already exists. See also redis.io.
ZRANGE # ZRANGE key start stop [BYSCORE | BYLEX] [REV] [LIMIT offset count] [WITHSCORES] Return a range of members in a sorted set. See also redis.io.
ZREM # ZREM key member [member ...] Remove one or more members from a sorted set. See also redis.io.
ZCARD # ZCARD key Get the number of members in a sorted set. See also redis.io.
ZCOUNT # ZCOUNT key min max Count the members in a sorted set with scores within the given values. See also redis.io.

title: Stored Procedures
content:
Defining Stored Programs in MySQL # If you use the mysql client program to define a stored program containing semicolon characters, a problem arises. By default, mysql itself recognizes the semicolon as a statement delimiter, so you must redefine the delimiter temporarily to cause mysql to pass the entire stored program definition to the server. To redefine the mysql delimiter, use the delimiter command. See also MySQL Reference manual.
mysql> delimiter // mysql> CREATE PROCEDURE dorepeat(p1 INT) -> BEGIN -> SET @x = 0; -> REPEAT SET @x = @x + 1; UNTIL @x > p1 END REPEAT; -> END -> // Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.00 sec) mysql> delimiter ;

title: Common Functions
content:
COALESCE # SELECT COALESCE(NULL, NULL, NULL, 'W3Schools.com', NULL, 'Example.com'); Return the first non-null value in a list. See also w3schools.
IFNULL # SELECT IFNULL(NULL, "W3Schools.com"); Return the specified value IF the expression is NULL, otherwise return the expression. See also w3schools.
IF # SELECT IF(500<1000, "YES", "NO"); The IF() function returns a value if a condition is TRUE, or another value if a condition is FALSE. See also w3schools.

title: Transations
content:
Usage # > MULTI OK > INCR foo QUEUED > INCR bar QUEUED > EXEC 1) (integer) 1 2) (integer) 1 DISCARD # > SET foo 1 OK > MULTI OK > INCR foo QUEUED > DISCARD OK > GET foo "1" Optimistic locking using check-and-set # WATCH mykey val = GET mykey val = val + 1 MULTI SET mykey $val EXEC It is also possible to use the UNWATCH command manually in order to flush all the watched keys.
See also # Transaction | Redis.

title: Views
Trigger
content:
Creating Trigger # mysql> CREATE TRIGGER ins_sum BEFORE INSERT ON account FOR EACH ROW SET @sum = @sum + NEW.amount; Show Trigger # mysql> SHOW TRIGGERS; Dropping Trigger # mysql> DROP TRIGGER IF EXISTS test.ins_sum; OLD and NEW Extensions # Within the trigger body, the OLD and NEW keywords enable you to access columns in the rows affected by a trigger. OLD and NEW are MySQL extensions to triggers; they are not case-sensitive.
In a BEFORE trigger, the NEW value for an AUTO_INCREMENT column is 0, not the sequence number that is generated automatically when the new row actually is inserted. mysql> delimiter // mysql> CREATE TRIGGER upd_check BEFORE UPDATE ON account FOR EACH ROW BEGIN IF NEW.amount < 0 THEN SET NEW.amount = 0; ELSEIF NEW.amount > 100 THEN SET NEW.amount = 100; END IF; END;// mysql> delimiter ; Attention # In the trigger, we can modify the data in any tables except the table that this trigger is for. Otherwise it will end in an infinite loop, because this trigger will fire itself. Reference # MySQL Reference Manual.

title: Oracle
content:
Find duplicates # SELECT column_name, COUNT(column_name) FROM table_name GROUP BY column_name HAVING COUNT(column_name) > 1; See also How do I find duplicate values in a table in Oracle?.
Removing duplicates # DELETE FROM your_table WHERE rowid not in (SELECT MIN(rowid) FROM your_table GROUP BY column1, column2, column3); See also Removing duplicate rows from table in Oracle.

title: Reading
content:
Design Pattern # Law of Demeter # Each unit should have only limited knowledge about other units: only units “closely” related to the current unit. Each unit should only talk to its friends; don’t talk to strangers. Only talk to your immediate friends. See also Law of Demeter - Wikipedia
Open Closed Principle # You can ship an abstract parent class (closed for modification) as part of your binary library, but people can still extend the functionality by adding new child classes (open for extension).
See also:
Writing Testable Code Do polymorphism or conditionals promote better design? Microservices # Events on the Outside vs Events on the Inside. Test # Favor Polymorphism Over Conditionals.
Writing Testable Code

title: Node
content:
Change the npm package registry # Temporary use: npm --registry https://registry.npm.taobao.org install express
Persistent use: npm config set registry https://registry.npm.taobao.org
Using cnpm: npm install -g cnpm --registry=https://registry.npm.taobao.org
Switch back to official registry: npm config set registry https://registry.npmjs.org/
Check current registry: npm config get registry
See also npm换源

title: Common
content:
Delete files older than x days # find /path/to/files* -mtime +5 -exec rm {} \; See also Delete Files Older Than x Days on Linux.
View systemd logs # journalctl -u service-name.service See also:
How to see full log from systemctl status service? How To Use Journalctl to View and Manipulate Systemd Logs Find directories that take up a lot of space # du -h -d 1 <PATH> | sort -hr See also Linux磁盘占满问题分析步骤.

title: Ubuntu
content:
Install .deb # sudo dpkg -i package-name.deb Set timezone # timedatectl set-timezone Asia/Shanghai Change NTP server # Open and Edit the configuration file
vim /etc/systemd/timesyncd.conf Add(Uncomment) NTP servers under the [Time] like following
[Time] NTP=10.0.0.1 Restart the service to apply the changes
systemctl restart systemd-timesyncd.service To check time sync status
timedatectl status See also How to change NTP server on Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS simply

title: Common Commands
content:
Rename branch # git branch -m NEW_BRANCH_NAME Ignore local file modifications # git update-index --no-skip-worktree /path/to/file Delete a Git branch locally # git branch --delete <branchname> See also How to delete a Git branch locally.
Update submodules recursively # git submodule update --init --recursive See also Git update submodules recursively
Config proxy # git config --global https.proxy http://127.0.0.1:7890 git config --global https.proxy https://127.0.0.1:7890 git config --global --unset http.proxy git config --global --unset https.proxy See also git 设置和取消代理
How to push empty commits to a remote repository # git commit --allow-empty -m "Trigger Build" See also Pushing empty commits to remote
